title: Grade 1 Mathematics
teaser: Operations and Algebraic Thinking, Number and Operations in Base Ten, Measurement and Data

children.title: Sums and Differences to 10
children.teaser: Students learn addition and subtraction of numbers to 10.

children.title: Embedded Numbers and Decompositions
children.teaser: Students focus on the number group configurations and decompose numbers into 2 visual sets.

children.title: Embedded Numbers To 10
children.teaser: Analyze and describe embedded numbers (to 10) using 5-groups and number bonds.

children.title: Embedded Numbers and Number Bonds
children.teaser: Reason about embedded numbers in varied configurations using number bonds.

children.title: One More
children.teaser: See and describe numbers of objects using 1 more within 5-group configurations.

children.title: Counting On from Embedded Numbers
children.teaser: Students use both concrete and pictorial situations to describe all of the decompositions of 6, 7, 8, 9, and 10.

children.title: Counting On to 6 and 7
children.teaser: Count on from one embedded number or part to totals of 6 and 7 (Day 1).

children.title: Counting On to 6 and 7 (Continued)
children.teaser: Count on from one embedded number or part to totals of 6 and 7 (Day 2)

children.title: Counting On to Totals of 8 and 9
children.teaser: Count on from one embedded number or part to totals of 8 and 9 (Day 1)

children.title: Counting On to Totals of 8 and 9 (Continued)
children.teaser: Count on from one embedded number or part to totals of 8 and 9 (Day 2)

children.title: Number Pairs of 10 as Number Bonds
children.teaser: Represent all the number pairs of 10 as number bond diagrams from a given scenario.

children.title: Addition Word Problems
children.teaser: Students develop an understand of addition word problems.

children.title: “Add To” and “Put Together” With Result Unknown
children.teaser: Solve add to with result unknown and put together with result unknown math stories.

children.title: “Put Together” With Result Unknown
children.teaser: Solve put together with result unknown math stories by drawing and using 5-group cards.

children.title: “Add To” With Change Unknown: A Context For Counting On
children.teaser: Solve add to with change unknown math stories as a context for counting on.

children.title: “Add To” With Change Unknown
children.teaser: Solve add to with change unknown math stories using 5-group cards.

children.title: “Put Together” and “Add  To” With Result and Change Unknown
children.teaser: Tell “put together” and “add to” with result unknown, “add to” with change unknown stories.

children.title: Strategies for Counting On
children.teaser: Students solve problems within the simplicity of equations.

children.title: Counting On Up To 3
children.teaser: Count on up to 3 more using numeral, 5-group cards, fingers to track the change (Day 1).

children.title: Counting On Up To 3 (Continued)
children.teaser: Count on up to 3 more using numeral, 5-group cards, fingers to track the change (Day 2)

children.title: Counting On:  Finding Unknown
children.teaser: Count on to find the unknown part in missing addend equations.

children.title: The Commutative Property of Addition and the Equal Sign
children.teaser: Understanding and application of the equal sign commutative property of addition.

children.title: Understanding the Equal Sign
children.teaser: Understand the meaning of the equal sign by pairing equivalent expressions and constructing number sentences (Day 1)

children.title: Understanding the Equal Sign (Continued)
children.teaser: Understand the meaning of the equal sign by pairing equivalent expressions and constructing number sentences (Day 2)

children.title: The Commutative Property
children.teaser: Represent the same story scenario with addends repositioned (the commutative property).

children.title: Apply The Commutative Property
children.teaser: Apply the commutative property to count on from a larger addend.

children.title: Development of Addition Fluency Within 10
children.teaser: Addition problems to 10.

children.title: Solve Double and Doubles Plus 1
children.teaser: Visualize and solve doubles and doubles plus 1 with 5-group cards.

children.title: Solving Problems With Common Addends
children.teaser: Make use of repeated reasoning on the addition chart by solving problems with common addends.

children.title: Structure On the Addition Chart
children.teaser: Make use of structure on the addition chart by looking for problems with same total.

children.title: Practice To Build Fluency
children.teaser: Practice to build fluency with facts to 10.

children.title: Subtraction as an Unknown Addend Problem
children.teaser: Subtraction vs. Addition

children.title: “Add To” With Change Unknown: Math Stories
children.teaser: Solve add to with change unknown math stories with addition and relate to subtraction.

children.title: Count On to Find Unknown Part
children.teaser: Count on using the number path to find an unknown part (Day 1).

children.title: Count On to Find Unknown Part (Continued)
children.teaser: Count on using the number path to find an unknown part (Day 2).

children.title: Subtraction Word Problems
children.teaser: From addition to subtraction through word problems.

children.title: “Take From” With Result Unknown
children.teaser: Solve take from with result unknown stories with math drawings, true number sentences and statements.

children.title: “Take Apart” With Addend Unknown
children.teaser: Solve take apart with addend unknown math stories with math drawings, equations, and statements.

children.title: “Add To” With Change Unknown: Math Stories with Drawings
children.teaser: Solve add to with change unknown math stories with drawings, relating addition and subtraction.

children.title: “Take From” With Change Unknown: Math Stories With Drawings
children.teaser: Solve take from with change unknown math stories with drawings.

children.title: “Put Together/Take Apart” With Addend Unknown: Math Stories
children.teaser: Solve put together/take apart with addend unknown math stories.

children.title: Decomposition Strategies for Subtraction
children.teaser: Subtraction strategies and concept.

children.title: Model 0 Less, 1 Less Pictorially, As Subtraction Number Sentences
children.teaser: Model 0 less and 1 less pictorially and as subtraction number sentences.

children.title: Model n – n, n – (n – 1) Pictorially, As Subtraction Sentences
children.teaser: Model n – n and n – (n – 1) pictorially and as subtraction sentences.

children.title: Relate Subtraction Facts Involving Fives and Doubles To Corresponding Decompositions
children.teaser: Relate subtraction facts involving fives and doubles to corresponding decompositions.

children.title: Subtraction From Ten
children.teaser: Relate subtraction from ten to corresponding decompositions.

children.title: Subtraction From Nine
children.teaser: Relate subtraction from nine to corresponding decompositions.

children.title: Development of Subtraction Fluency Within 10
children.teaser: Students develop fluency skills.

children.title: Repeated Reasoning and Structure Using the Addition Chart
children.teaser: Make use of repeated reasoning and structure using the addition chart to solve subtraction problems.

children.title: Create Sets of Related Addition, Subtraction Facts Using Addition Chart
children.teaser: Analyze the addition chart to create sets of related addition and subtraction facts.

children.title: Introduction to Place Value Through Addition and Subtraction Within 20
children.teaser: They begin addition and subtraction problems involving teen numbers.

children.title: Counting On or Making Ten to Solve
children.teaser: Result/Total Unknown Problems

children.teaser: Solve word problems with three addends, two of which make ten

children.title: Associative And Commutative Properties To Make Ten With Three Addends
children.teaser: Use the associative and commutative properties to make ten with three addends.

children.title: Make Ten When One Addend Is 9
children.teaser: Make ten when one addend is 9 (Day 1).

children.title: Make Ten When One Addend Is 9 (Continued)
children.teaser: Make ten when one addend is 9 (Day 2).

children.title: Counting On and Making Ten When One Addend Is 9
children.teaser: Compare efficiency of counting on and making ten when one addend is 9.

children.title: Commutative Property To Make Ten
children.teaser: Apply the commutative property to make ten.

children.title: Make Ten When One Addend Is 8
children.teaser: Students decompose one addend to make ten (Day 1).

children.title: Make Ten When One Addend Is 8 (Continued)
children.teaser: Students decompose one addend to make ten (Day 2).

children.title: Making Ten When One Addend Is 8
children.teaser: Compare efficiency of counting on and making ten when one addend is 8.

children.title: Addends Of 7, 8, 9
children.teaser: Solve problems with addends of 7, 8, and 9.

children.title: Put Together With Total Unknown Problems
children.teaser: Share and critique peer solution strategies for put together with total unknown word problems.

children.title: Counting On or Making Ten
children.teaser: Counting On or Making Ten to Solve Result/Total Unknown Problems

children.title: Subtraction Of 9 From 10
children.teaser: Solve word problems with subtraction of 9 from 10 (Day 1).

children.title: Subtraction Of 9 From 10 (Continued)
children.teaser: Solve word problems with subtraction of 9 from 10 (Day 2).

children.title: Model Subtraction Of 9
children.teaser: Model subtraction of 9 from teen numbers (Day 1).

children.title: Model Subtraction Of 9 (Continued)
children.teaser: Model subtraction of 9 from teen numbers (Day 2).

children.title: Relate Counting On To Making Ten and Taking From Ten
children.teaser: Relate counting on to making ten and taking from ten.

children.title: Subtraction Of 8 From Teen Numbers
children.teaser: Model subtraction of 8 from teen numbers (Day 1).

children.title: Subtraction Of 8 From Teen Numbers (Continued)
children.teaser: Model subtraction of 8 from teen numbers (Day 2).

children.title: Comparing Efficiency
children.teaser: Compare efficiency of counting on and taking from ten.

children.title: Subtract 7, 8, 9
children.teaser: Subtract 7, 8, and 9 from teen numbers.

children.title: Peer Solution Strategies For Word Problems Using Teen Numbers
children.teaser: Share and critique peer solution strategies for take from with result unknown and take apart with addend unknown word problems from the teens.

children.title: Change or Addend Unknown
children.teaser: Strategies for Solving Change or Addend Unknown Problems

children.title: Put Together/ Take Apart: Addend Unknown
children.teaser: Solve put together/take apart with addend unknown problems; relate counting on to take from ten.

children.title: Add To: Change Unknown
children.teaser: Solve add to with change unknown problems, relating varied addition and subtraction strategies.

children.title: Take From: Change Unknown
children.teaser: Strategize to solve take from with change unknown problems.

children.title: Equal Sign and Equivalent Expressions
children.teaser: Strategize and apply understanding of the equal sign to solve equivalent expressions.

children.title: Decompositions of Teen Numbers
children.teaser: Varied Problems with Decompositions of Teen Numbers as 1 Ten and Some Ones

children.title: Identify Ten As A Unit
children.teaser: Identify 1 ten as a unit by renaming representations of 10.

children.title: Decomposing and Composing Teens
children.teaser: Solve addition, subtraction problems decomposing and composing teen numbers as 1 ten and some ones.

children.title: Solve addition problems using ten as a unit
children.teaser: Solve addition problems using ten as a unit, and write two-step solutions.

children.title: Solve subtraction problems using ten as a unit
children.teaser: Solve subtraction problems using ten as a unit, and write two-step solutions.

children.title: Ordering and Comparing Length Measurements as Numbers
children.teaser: Students explore the usefulness of measuring with similar units.

children.title: Indirect Comparison in Length Measurement
children.teaser: Students use the length of one object is used to compare that of other objects.

children.title: Compare Length Directly
children.teaser: Compare length directly and consider importance of aligning endpoints.

children.title: Compare Lengths Indirectly
children.teaser: Compare length using indirect comparison by finding objects longer than, shorter than, and equal in length to that of a string.

children.title: Order Three Lengths
children.teaser: Order three lengths using indirect comparison.

children.title: Standard Length Units
children.teaser: Introducing the idea of a length unit.

children.title: Length and Centimeter Cubes
children.teaser: Express the length of an object using centimeter cubes with no gaps or overlaps.

children.title: Measure With Cubes Using 'Centimeter'
children.teaser: Rename and measure with centimeter cubes, using their standard unit name of centimeters.

children.title: Compare Length Of Objects and Solve Problems
children.teaser: Compare Length Of Objects, Solve “Compare With” Difference Unknown Problems

children.title: Non-Standard and Standard Length Units
children.teaser: Students explore usefulness of measuring with similar units.

children.title: Measure Same Objects With Different Units
children.teaser: Measure the same objects with different non-standard units simultaneously to see need for consistent units.

children.title: Understanding of Comparing Measurements
children.teaser: Understanding The Need To Use Same Units When Comparing Measurements

children.title: Compare With Difference Unknown: Using Centimeters
children.teaser: Answer compare with difference unknown problems about lengths of two different objects measured in centimeters.

children.title: Data Interpretation
children.teaser: Students explore graphs and data points.

children.title: Data and Number Points
children.teaser: Collect, sort, organize data, ask and answer questions about the number of data points (Day 1).

children.title: Data and Number Points (Continued)
children.teaser: Collect, sort, organize data, ask and answer questions about the number of data points (Day 2).

children.title: Varied Word Problems About A Data Set
children.teaser: Ask and answer varied word problem types about a data set with three categories (Day 1).

children.title: Varied Word Problems About A Data Set (Continued)
children.teaser: Ask and answer varied word problem types about a data set with three categories (Day 2).

children.title: Place Value, Comparison, Addition and Subtraction to 40
children.teaser: Use place value to add, subtract, and compare.

children.title: Tens and Ones
children.teaser: Students represent numbers to 40 in various ways.

children.title: Counting By Ones and Tens
children.teaser: Compare the efficiency of counting by ones and counting by tens.

children.title: Tens and Ones Within A Two-Digit Number
children.teaser: Use the place value chart to record and name tens and ones within a two-digit number.

children.title: Two-Digit Numbers As Tens and Some Ones or All Ones
children.teaser: Interpret two-digit numbers as either tens and some ones or as all ones.

children.title: Two-Digit Numbers That Combine Tens and Ones
children.teaser: Write and interpret two-digit numbers as addition sentences that combine tens and ones.

children.title: More and Less Than A Two-Digit Number
children.teaser: Identify 10 more, 10 less, 1 more, and 1 less than a two-digit number.

children.title: Use Dimes and Pennies As Representations of Tens and Ones
children.teaser: Use dimes and pennies as representations of tens and ones.

children.title: Comparison of Pairs of Two-Digit Numbers
children.teaser: Use place value to compare numbers from left to right.

children.title: Compare Two Quantities
children.teaser: Compare two quantities, and identify the greater or lesser of the two given numerals.

children.title: Compare Quantities and Numerals
children.teaser: Compare quantities and numerals from left to right.

children.title: Use >, =, < to Compare
children.teaser: Use the symbols >, =, and < to compare quantities and numerals (Day 1)

children.title: Use >, =, < to Compare (Continued)
children.teaser: Use the symbols >, =, and < to compare quantities and numerals (Day 2)

children.title: Addition and Subtraction of Tens
children.teaser: Connect addition and subtraction of tens to that of ones.

children.title: Add and Subtract Tens From A Multiple of 10
children.teaser: Represent the addition of ten using the numeral and then writing as units of ten.

children.title: Add Tens To A Two-Digit Number
children.teaser: Recognize that when tens are added to a number, the ones remain the same.

children.title: Addition of Tens or Ones to a Two-Digit Number
children.teaser: Students apply the strategy of counting on and making ten.

children.title: Adding Across A Ten
children.teaser: Use counting on and the make ten strategy when adding across a ten (Day 1).

children.title: Adding Across A Ten (Continued)
children.teaser: Use counting on and the make ten strategy when adding across a ten (Day 2).

children.title: Single-Digit Sums
children.teaser: Use single-digit sums to support solutions for analogous sums to 40.

children.title: Ones plus Ones or Tens plus Tens
children.teaser: Add ones and ones or tens and tens (Day 1).

children.title: Ones plus Ones or Tens plus Tens (Continued)
children.teaser: Add ones and ones or tens and tens (Day 2).

children.title: Peer Strategies For Adding Two-Digit Numbers
children.teaser: Share and critique peer strategies for adding two-digit numbers.

children.title: Varied Problem Types Within 20
children.teaser: Continue developing their skills with adding single-digit and double-digit numbers.

children.title: Use Tape Diagrams To Solve Total And Result Unknown Problems
children.teaser: Use tape diagrams to solve total unknown and result unknown problems.

children.title: Part-Whole Relationships
children.teaser: Part–whole relationships within tape diagrams when solving a variety of problem types (Day 1).

children.title: Part-Whole Relationships (Continued)
children.teaser: Part–whole relationships within tape diagrams when solving a variety of problem types (Day 2).

children.title: Write Word Problems Of Varied Types
children.teaser: Write word problems of varied types.

children.title: Addition of Tens and Ones to a Two-Digit Number
children.teaser: Interpreting two-digit numbers in varied combinations of tens and ones.

children.title: Two-Digit Numbers: Tens and Ones
children.teaser: Interpret two-digit numbers as tens and ones, including cases with more than 9 ones.

children.title: Two-Digit Numbers With Ones Digit Sum
children.teaser: Add two-digit numbers when the ones digits have a sum less than/equal to 10 (Day 1).

children.title: Two-Digit Numbers With Ones Digit Sum (Continued)
children.teaser: Add two-digit numbers when the ones digits have a sum less than/equal to 10 (Day 2).

children.title: Ones Digits Sum Greater Than 10
children.teaser: Add a pair of two-digit numbers when the ones digits have sum greater than 10 (Day 1).

children.title: Ones Digits Sum Greater Than 10 (Continued)
children.teaser: Add a pair of two-digit numbers when the ones digits have sum greater than 10  (Day 2).

children.title: Varied Sums In The Ones (Continued)

children.title: Identifying, Composing, and Partitioning Shapes
children.teaser: Students consider part–whole relationships through a geometric lens.

children.title: Attributes of Shapes
children.teaser: Begin the exploration by creating and describing two-dimensional shapes without naming them.

children.title: Classify Shapes Based On Defining Attributes
children.teaser: Classify shapes based on defining attributes using examples, variants, and non-examples.

children.title: Find and Name Two-Dimensional Shapes
children.teaser: Find and name two-dimensional shapes based on defining attributes of sides and corners.

children.title: Find and Name Three-Dimensional Shapes
children.teaser: Find and name three-dimensional shapes based on defining attributes of faces and points.

children.title: Part–Whole Relationships Within Composite Shapes
children.teaser: Explore relationships between parts and wholes.

children.title: Create Composite Shapes From Two-Dimensional Shapes
children.teaser: Create composite shapes from two-dimensional shapes.

children.title: Compose A New Shape From Composite Shapes
children.teaser: Compose a new shape from composite shapes.

children.title: Create and Describe A Composite Shape From Three-Dimensional Shapes
children.teaser: Create a composite shape from three-dimensional shapes and describe it using shape names and positions.

children.title: Halves and Quarters of Rectangles and Circles
children.teaser: Naming equal parts of wholes, specifically halves and fourths.

children.title: Name and Count Shapes As Parts Of A Whole
children.teaser: Name and count shapes as parts of a whole, recognizing relative sizes of the parts.

children.title: Partitioning Shapes
children.teaser: Partition shapes and identify halves and quarters of circles and rectangles (Day 1).

children.title: Partitioning Shapes (Continued)
children.teaser: Partition shapes and identify halves and quarters of circles and rectangles (Day 2).

children.title: Application of Halves to Tell Time
children.teaser: Tell time to the hour and half-hour.

children.title: Construct A Paper Clock To Tell Time To The Hour
children.teaser: Construct a paper clock by partitioning a circle and tell time to the hour.

children.title: Recognizing Halves Within A Clock
children.teaser: Recognize halves within a circular clock face and tell time to the half hour (Day 1).

children.title: Recognizing Halves Within A Clock (Continued…)
children.teaser: Recognize halves within a circular clock face and tell time to the half hour (Day 2).

children.title: Recognizing Halves Within A Clock (Continued)
children.teaser: Recognize halves within a circular clock face and tell time to the half hour (Day 3).

children.title: Place Value, Comparison, Addition and Subtraction to 100

children.title: Comparison Word Problems
children.teaser: Exploring the challenge of comparison word problems.

children.title: Compare With Difference Unknown
children.teaser: Solve: compare with difference unknown problem types.

children.title: Compare With Bigger Or Smaller Unknown
children.teaser: Solve: compare with bigger or smaller unknown problem types.

children.title: Numbers to 120

children.teaser: Use the place value chart to record and name tens and ones up to 100.

children.teaser: Write and interpret two-digit numbers to 100 as addition sentences that combine tens and ones.

children.teaser: Use the symbols >, =, and < to compare quantities and numerals to 100.

children.teaser: Count to 120 in unit form using only tens and one.

children.teaser: Add pairs of two-digit numbers to sums within 100.

children.teaser: Add and subtract multiples of 10 from multiples of 10 to 100, including dimes.

children.title: Add Multiple Of 10
children.teaser: Add a multiple of 10 to any two-digit number within 100.

children.title: Ones digits' sum less than/ equal to 10
children.teaser: Add pair of two-digit numbers when ones digits have sum less than/equal to 10.

children.title: Ones Digits’ Sum Greater Than 10 - Drawing and Recording the Ten (Continued)

children.teaser: Add two-digit numbers with varied sums in the ones, compare results of different recording methods.

children.title: Adding Two-Digit Numbers With Varied Sums
children.teaser: Solve and share strategies for adding two-digit numbers with varied sums.

children.title: Coins and Their Values
children.teaser: Students identify and use the coins based on their image, name, and/or value.

children.teaser: Identify pennies, nickels, and dimes.  Decompose values of nickels and dimes using pennies and nickels.

children.teaser: Identify quarters by their image, name, or value. Decompose the value using pennies, nickels, dimes.

children.title: Coins: Their Image, Name, Or Value
children.teaser: Identify varied coins by their image, name, or value. Add one cent to any coin.

children.title: Pennies From Any Single Coin

children.title: Dimes and Pennies
children.teaser: Use dimes and pennies as representations of numbers to 120.

children.title: Varied Problem Types Within 20
children.teaser: Focus on solving various problem types and learn from their peers’ strategies.

children.teaser: Solve compare with bigger or smaller unknown problem types (Day 1).

children.title: Compare With Bigger Or Smaller Unknown (Continued)
children.teaser: Solve compare with bigger or smaller unknown problem types (Day 2).
